entries.title: Kremlin Bans Sales Of Russian Oil To Countries That Impose Price Cap
entries.description: The action follows moves by the Group of Seven nations that bar Western companies from insuring, financing or shipping Russian crude at above $60 a barrel.

entries.title: Israeli Officials Condemn Netanyahu's Coalition Deals
entries.description: Leaders have raised concerns over coalition agreements being made between incoming Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his far-right allies ahead of the government’s swearing-in expected this week.

entries.title: Iran Relies on Loyalists as Bulwark Against Protests
entries.description: Tehran empowers its supporters, including the Basij paramilitary group, with perks, jobs and guns, making them a force for maintaining the status quo.

entries.title: South Korean Military Apologizes for Lack of Response to North's Drones
entries.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol criticized the military’s response to the border intrusion and vowed to fast-track plans for a military unit specializing in drones.

entries.title: India's Upscale Housing Market Defies Global Trend
entries.description: Affluent Indians who kept working during the pandemic but throttled back on spending are returning to the country’s housing market in force.

entries.title: Wealthy Chinese, Fed Up at Home, Find Haven in Japan
entries.description: A growing number of affluent Chinese are coming to Japan to live, in an indication of social and political tensions in China.

entries.title: Chinese Rush for Exit as Beijing Ends Zero-Covid and Opens Its Doors
entries.description: Sales of air tickets out of China soared as people leapt at the chance to put the restrictions of zero-Covid behind them, with Singapore, South Korea, Hong Kong and Japan favorite travel choices.

entries.title: Japanese Companies Reach Natural-Gas Deals
entries.description: Japanese companies said they reached deals with Omani and U.S. producers for mid- to long-term supplies of liquefied natural gas.

entries.title: Taiwan to Extend Mandatory Military Service
entries.description: Conscription will increase to a full year from the current four months starting in 2024, President Tsai Ing-wen said.

entries.title: Former South Korean President Lee Myung-bak Given Special Pardon
entries.description: The ex-leader was convicted of embezzlement and bribery in 2018, but his prison sentence was suspended in June because of poor health.
